page.title: Hundred Years' War

infobox.caption: {{nowrap|clockwise, from top left: the [[battle of la rochelle]],}}<br>the [[battle of agincourt]],<br> the [[battle of patay]],<br>[[joan of arc]] at the [[siege of orléans]]
infobox.date: 24 may 1337 – 19 october 1453{{efn|24 may 1337 is the day when [[philip vi of france]] confiscated [[duchy of aquitaine|aquitaine]] from [[edward iii of england]], who responded by claiming the french throne. [[bordeaux]] fell to the french on 19 october 1453; there were no more hostilities afterwards.}}<br>({{age in years, months, weeks and days|month1=05|day1=24|year1=1337|month2=10|day2=19|year2=1453|df=y}})
infobox.place: [[kingdom of france|france]], the [[low countries]], [[great britain]], [[iberian peninsula]]
infobox.result:
{{plainlist|
* '''victory of house of valois and its allies'''
* • [[house of valois]] retains the french throne; english and french monarchies remain separate
* • [[agnatic primogeniture]] confirmed as the law of french royal succession
* • [[house of valois#centralization of power|strengthening of the french monarchy]]
* • [[house of plantagenet]] is weakened, leading to the [[wars of the roses]]
* • rise of [[nationalism|nationalistic identities]] in england and france
* • [[english claims to the french throne]] [[de facto]] abandoned
* • [[chivalry#the end of chivalry|decline of chivalry]]
* • [[feudalism#end of european feudalism|decline of feudalism]]}}
infobox.territory: [[kingdom of england|england]] permanently loses all of its previous continental possessions but gains the [[pale of calais]].
